answers.answer: Hello and welcome to the forum. As age increases our body metabolism slows down. At this time if we eat more, eat wrong foods and do not exercise than it can cause uncontrolled weight gain. Medical problems like diabetes mellitus can cause increased thirst and appetite but you tend to lose weight if you have diabetes, while obesity can be  a risk factor for developing diabetes mellitus. Drugs like steroids, antidepressants can cause weight gain. Hypothyroidism is another possibility. Fluid retention due to heart failure, kidney failure can lead to weight gain. Headache and leg pain may/may not be related to your other symptoms.Stress, migraine can cause headaches. Leg pain can be due to diabetes mellitus, vitamin B12 or vitamin B6 deficiency, thyroid disorders .Start with light exercises like brisk walking and dietary control. Consult  a doctor for complete evaluation of your condition. Do write to us again on how you are doing.Take care and good luck!

question: I am suddenly hungry all of the time. I am 63 years old and getting overweight, even though I was thin all of my life. I seem to never be able to get enough to eat. Do you know what might be wrong with me? I also have frequent headaches and leg pain but I was getting hungry all the time before the other symptoms appeared.
title: Eating all the time
